mappings.description: Create Container Request id
mappings.doc: Unique id for the container.

mappings.description: Reference to a Deployment using the container
mappings.doc: The deployment in which the container is used, so the device can send deployment events to Astarte for the create request

mappings.description: Container image id
mappings.doc: The id of the image to use when creating the container.

mappings.description: Container network ids
mappings.doc: The ids of the network to connect with the container.

mappings.description: Container volume ids
mappings.doc: The ids of the volumes to mount on the container.

mappings.description: Container device mappings ids
mappings.doc: The ids of the device mappings to mount on the container.

mappings.description: Container hostname
mappings.doc: The hostname to use for the container, as a valid RFC 1123 hostname.

mappings.description: Container restart policy
mappings.doc: The behavior to apply when the container exits. Possible values are: ['', 'no', 'always' 'unless-stopped', 'on-failure']

mappings.description: Container environment
mappings.doc: Array of key=value environment variables. The key cannot contain `=`.

mappings.description: Container binds
mappings.doc: A list of volume bindings for this container. Each volume binding is a string in one of these forms: host-src:container-dest[:options], or volume-name:container-dest[:options]. The container-dest must be an absolute path.

mappings.description: Network mode used for this container.
mappings.doc: Supported standard values are: bridge, host, none, and container:<name|id>. Any other value is taken as a custom network's name to which this container should connect to. If you are using a different container engine than docker, there could be other values.

mappings.description: Container port bindings
mappings.doc: Array of ip:[host_port:]container_port[/protocol] | [hostPort:]containerPort[/protocol]. Protocol is TCP by default

mappings.description: List of hostname/IP to add to the container's /etc/hosts
mappings.doc: A list of hostnames/IP mappings to add to the container's /etc/hosts file. Specified in the form ["hostname:IP"]. You can use the `host-gateway` to connect to the host IP

mappings.description: A list of kernel capabilities to add to the container.
mappings.doc: A list of kernel capabilities to add to the container.

mappings.description: A list of kernel capabilities to drop from the container.
mappings.doc: A list of kernel capabilities to drop from the container.

mappings.description: The length of a CPU period in microseconds.
mappings.doc: Unset if the value is -1 (or negative) and the cpuQuota must also be unset.

mappings.description: Microseconds of CPU time that the container can get in a CPU period.
mappings.doc: Unset if the value is -1 (or negative) and the cpuPeriod must also be unset.

mappings.description: The length of a CPU real-time period in microseconds.
mappings.doc: The length of a CPU real-time period in microseconds. Set to 0 to allocate no time allocated to real-time tasks. Unset if the value is -1 (or negative).

mappings.description: The length of a CPU real-time runtime in microseconds.
mappings.doc: The length of a CPU real-time runtime in microseconds. Set to 0 to allocate no time allocated to real-time tasks. Unset if the value is -1 (or negative).

mappings.description: Memory limit in bytes.
mappings.doc: Memory limit in bytes. Default to 0 for unlimited. Unset if the value is -1 (or negative).

mappings.description: Memory soft limit in bytes. Default to 0 for unlimited. Unset if the value is -1 (or negative).
Total memory limit (memory + swap).
mappings.doc: Total memory limit (memory + swap). Set as -1 to enable unlimited swap. Unset if the value is -2 (or more negative).

mappings.description: Memory swappiness
mappings.doc: Tune a container's memory swappiness behavior. Accepts an integer between 0 and 100. Unset if the value is -1 (or negative).

mappings.description: Driver that this container uses to mount volumes.
Storage driver options for this container.
mappings.doc: Storage driver options for this container, in the form "size=120G".

mappings.description: Mount the container's root filesystem as read only.
A map of container directories which should be replaced by tmpfs mounts.
mappings.doc:
A map of container directories which should be replaced by tmpfs mounts, and their corresponding mount options. For example:
 "/run=rw,noexec,nosuid,size=65536k"

mappings.description: Run privileged
mappings.doc: Runs the exec process with extended privileges.
